items.title: Putin-Trump summit: Russia ‘cannot have veto’ on Ukraine’s EU and Nato membership, say European leaders – live
items.standfirst: Zelenskyy will meet Trump in US on Monday after US president’s talks with Putin ended without a ceasefire deal, while Keir Starmer has echoed European Council’s call for robust security guarantees for UkraineNo deal after brief Trump-Putin talks on Ukraine in AlaskaThe president has yet to deplane, but is currently greeting Alaska governor Muke Dunleavy and senators Lisa Murkowski and Dan Sullivan, all Republicans, aboard Air Force One, per the White House.White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt also says that for the expanded bilateral meeting and lunch, Trump, Rubio, and Witkoff will be joined by treasury secretary Scott Bessent, commerce secretary Howard Lutnick, defense secretary Pete Hegseth, and White House chief of staff Susie Wiles. Continue reading...
items.content: Zelenskyy will meet Trump in US on Monday after US president’s talks with Putin ended without a ceasefire deal, while Keir Starmer has echoed European Council’s call for robust security guarantees for UkraineNo deal after brief Trump-Putin talks on Ukraine in AlaskaThe president has yet to deplane, but is currently greeting Alaska governor Muke Dunleavy and senators Lisa Murkowski and Dan Sullivan, all Republicans, aboard Air Force One, per the White House.White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt also says that for the expanded bilateral meeting and lunch, Trump, Rubio, and Witkoff will be joined by treasury secretary Scott Bessent, commerce secretary Howard Lutnick, defense secretary Pete Hegseth, and White House chief of staff Susie Wiles. Continue reading...

items.title: Russia jubilant after Putin leaves Trump summit without making concessions
items.standfirst: With no sanctions imposed on Russia, and no ceasefire agreed, Moscow feels it has the upper handPutin-Trump summit: Russia ‘cannot have veto’ on Ukraine’s EU and Nato membership, say European leaders – liveRussia’s reaction to Donald Trump’s summit with Vladimir Putin in Alaska has been nothing short of jubilant, with Moscow celebrating the fact that the Russian leader met his US counterpart without making concessions and now faces no sanctions despite rejecting Trump’s ceasefire demands.“The meeting proved that negotiations are possible without preconditions,” wrote former president Dmitry Medvedev on Telegram. He added that the summit showed that talks could continue as Russia wages war in Ukraine. Continue reading...
items.content: With no sanctions imposed on Russia, and no ceasefire agreed, Moscow feels it has the upper handPutin-Trump summit: Russia ‘cannot have veto’ on Ukraine’s EU and Nato membership, say European leaders – liveRussia’s reaction to Donald Trump’s summit with Vladimir Putin in Alaska has been nothing short of jubilant, with Moscow celebrating the fact that the Russian leader met his US counterpart without making concessions and now faces no sanctions despite rejecting Trump’s ceasefire demands.“The meeting proved that negotiations are possible without preconditions,” wrote former president Dmitry Medvedev on Telegram. He added that the summit showed that talks could continue as Russia wages war in Ukraine. Continue reading...

items.title: Zelenskyy to meet Trump on Monday after Putin summit briefing
items.standfirst: Ukrainian president to make first return to White House since infamous row with Trump in FebruaryZelenskyy to meet US president in Washington on Monday after Trump-Putin summit ends without deal – liveUkraine’s president said he would fly to Washington on Monday to meet with Donald Trump after a telephone call with the US president in which he was briefed on the key points of the Alaska summit. The meeting will mark the first return to the White House for Volodymyr Zelenskyy since his infamous row with Trump in late February.Zelenskyy said that his hour-long one-on-one conversation with Trump was “long and substantive”. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian president to make first return to White House since infamous row with Trump in FebruaryZelenskyy to meet US president in Washington on Monday after Trump-Putin summit ends without deal – liveUkraine’s president said he would fly to Washington on Monday to meet with Donald Trump after a telephone call with the US president in which he was briefed on the key points of the Alaska summit. The meeting will mark the first return to the White House for Volodymyr Zelenskyy since his infamous row with Trump in late February.Zelenskyy said that his hour-long one-on-one conversation with Trump was “long and substantive”. items.title: Zelensky to meet Trump after US-Russia summit: What to expect?
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Saturday (August 16) that he plans to meet US President Donald Trump in Washington next week after Trump’s summit with Russia’s Vladimir Putin ended without an agreement to end the war in Ukraine. FRANCE 24's James Andre gives us his analysis. What was the outcome of the Alaska summit? What can we expect? "We do not have the parameters of what was actually negotiated during the summit", he said.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Saturday (August 16) that he plans to meet US President Donald Trump in Washington next week after Trump’s summit with Russia’s Vladimir Putin ended without an agreement to end the war in Ukraine. FRANCE 24's James Andre gives us his analysis. What was the outcome of the Alaska summit? What can we expect? "We do not have the parameters of what was actually negotiated during the summit", he said.

items.title: Zelensky says he will meet US president in Washington
items.standfirst: Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky will head to Washington to discuss "ending the killing and the war" with US President Donald Trump, he announced Saturday (August 16). The Washington meeting is set to take place three days after Trump's talks with Putin in Alaska ended with no ceasefire announcement or apparent breakthrough to end Moscow's more than three-year-long invasion. FRANCE 24's Emmanuelle Chaze tells us more about the outcome of this summit.
items.content: Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelensky will head to Washington to discuss "ending the killing and the war" with US President Donald Trump, he announced Saturday (August 16). The Washington meeting is set to take place three days after Trump's talks with Putin in Alaska ended with no ceasefire announcement or apparent breakthrough to end Moscow's more than three-year-long invasion. FRANCE 24's Emmanuelle Chaze tells us more about the outcome of this summit.

items.title: Alaska summit: Putin managed 'to get out of the international isolation'
items.standfirst: The high-stakes summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian leader Vladimir Putin began with a warm welcome and a flyover by screaming jets at a US military base in Alaska but ended with a thud Friday after they conceded that they had failed to reach any agreements on how to end the Russia-Ukraine war. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Alison Sargent is joined by Natia Seskuria, associate fellow at Royal Services Institue. 'I think Putin is more of a winner out of this because he managed to get out of the international isolation", she said.
items.content: The high-stakes summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian leader Vladimir Putin began with a warm welcome and a flyover by screaming jets at a US military base in Alaska but ended with a thud Friday after they conceded that they had failed to reach any agreements on how to end the Russia-Ukraine war. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Alison Sargent is joined by Natia Seskuria, associate fellow at Royal Services Institue. 'I think Putin is more of a winner out of this because he managed to get out of the international isolation", she said.

items.title: Trump, Putin end joint press conference without taking questions
items.standfirst: Donald Trump said on Friday (August 15) that he and Russian President Vladimir Putin did not reach an agreement to resolve Moscow's war in Ukraine after a nearly three-hour summit in Alaska, though he characterized the meeting as "very productive." Trump and Putin held a press conference after the summit and took no questions. David Smith, Washington bureau chief for The Guardian, tells us more about the press conference.
items.content: Donald Trump said on Friday (August 15) that he and Russian President Vladimir Putin did not reach an agreement to resolve Moscow's war in Ukraine after a nearly three-hour summit in Alaska, though he characterized the meeting as "very productive." Trump and Putin held a press conference after the summit and took no questions. David Smith, Washington bureau chief for The Guardian, tells us more about the press conference.

items.title: Takeaways from the Trump-Putin news conference in Alaska
items.standfirst: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin held a 12-minute news conference on Friday after meeting for nearly three hours in Anchorage, Alaska. Mr. Trump said he made "great progress" in talks but didn't announce a ceasefire deal. Neither took questions from reporters.
items.content: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin held a 12-minute news conference on Friday after meeting for nearly three hours in Anchorage, Alaska. Mr. Trump said he made "great progress" in talks but didn't announce a ceasefire deal. Neither took questions from reporters.

items.title: Putin says that an agreement reached will 'pave the path toward peace in Ukraine'
items.standfirst: After greeting President Trump in Anchorage as his “dear neighbor,” Russian President Vladimir Putin opened the evening press conference by saying their agreement will “pave the path toward peace in Ukraine.” He said a permanent deal will require addressing the conflict’s root causes and agreed with Trump that Ukraine’s security must be ensured.
items.content: After greeting President Trump in Anchorage as his “dear neighbor,” Russian President Vladimir Putin opened the evening press conference by saying their agreement will “pave the path toward peace in Ukraine.” He said a permanent deal will require addressing the conflict’s root causes and agreed with Trump that Ukraine’s security must be ensured.

items.title: Iowa governor directs state National Guard to help ICE operations
items.standfirst: Iowa Republican Gov. Kim Reynolds this week directed the state's National Guard to assist with Immigration and Customs Enforcement operations beginning in September. CBS News Iowa station KCCI's chief political reporter Amanda Rooker joins "The Takeout" to discuss.
items.content: Iowa Republican Gov. Kim Reynolds this week directed the state's National Guard to assist with Immigration and Customs Enforcement operations beginning in September. CBS News Iowa station KCCI's chief political reporter Amanda Rooker joins "The Takeout" to discuss.

items.title: Warm greeting belies Ukraine bloodshed as Trump brings Putin in from the cold
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin met for a high-stakes summit in Alaska on Friday that started with a handshake, a smile and a ride in the presidential limousine, marking an unusually warm reception for a US adversary who launched Europe's largest war since 1945 and is wanted by the International Criminal Court.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Trump will meet with Zelenskyy in Washington on Monday, according to reports.
• The meeting follows Trump's summit with Putin in Alaska, which ended without a ceasefire.
• European leaders have urged the US to offer security guarantees to Ukraine.
• Trump announced the meeting with Zelenskyy on Truth Social after the Putin meeting.
• Russia celebrated the summit, as no sanctions or ceasefire were agreed upon.

items.standfirst: Most of the dead were reported in the mountainous province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, with more rain forecastThe death toll from heavy monsoon rains that have triggered flash floods across northern Pakistan has risen to at least 321 people in the past 48 hours, the country’s disaster authority said on Saturday.The majority of the deaths, 307, were recorded in the mountainous Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, according to the National Disaster Management Authority. items.title: At least 321 people killed in monsoon flash floods in Pakistan
items.standfirst: The death toll from heavy monsoon rains that have triggered flash floods across northern Pakistan has risen to at least 321 people in the past 48 hours, the country's disaster authority said Saturday.
items.content: The death toll from heavy monsoon rains that have triggered flash floods across northern Pakistan has risen to at least 321 people in the past 48 hours, the country's disaster authority said Saturday.

items.title: Flash floods kill at least 159 people in Pakistan after huge cloudburst
items.standfirst: Search for the missing continues in north-west after downpour also sparks deadly flooding and landslides in IndiaA massive cloudburst has triggered flash floods in north-west Pakistan, killing at least 157 people, as rescuers continued to search for people missing after floods in neighbouring India.Mohammad Suhail, a provincial emergency services spokesperson, said 78 bodies were recovered from various parts of Buner district in the north-west province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa by noon on Friday, and a further 79 were pulled later from the rubble of collapsed homes and flooded villages. Continue reading...
items.content: Search for the missing continues in north-west after downpour also sparks deadly flooding and landslides in IndiaA massive cloudburst has triggered flash floods in north-west Pakistan, killing at least 157 people, as rescuers continued to search for people missing after floods in neighbouring India.Mohammad Suhail, a provincial emergency services spokesperson, said 78 bodies were recovered from various parts of Buner district in the north-west province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa by noon on Friday, and a further 79 were pulled later from the rubble of collapsed homes and flooded villages. Continue reading...

clusters.ai_summary:
• Flash floods in Pakistan have caused over 320 deaths in the last 48 hours.
• The majority of deaths, 307, occurred in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.
• Rescue efforts are underway as thousands remain stranded in affected villages.
• Heavy monsoon rains triggered the flash floods across northern Pakistan.
• The death toll continues to rise as search and rescue operations continue.

items.standfirst: Breach at Inflite The Jet Centre is latest in series of leaks involving private information of Afghan refugees A contractor linked to the UK Ministry of Defence has been hit by a cyber-attack, exposing personal data linked to Afghan resettlement efforts. It is the latest in a series of breaches…
items.content: Breach at Inflite The Jet Centre is latest in series of leaks involving private information of Afghan refugees A contractor linked to the UK Ministry of Defence has been hit by a cyber-attack, exposing personal data linked to Afghan resettlement efforts. It is the latest in a series of breaches…

items.title: Cyber-attack on MoD-linked contractor exposes data of Afghans in resettlement scheme
items.standfirst: Breach at Inflite The Jet Centre is latest in series of leaks involving private information of Afghan refugeesA contractor linked to the UK Ministry of Defence has been hit by a cyber-attack, exposing personal data linked to Afghan resettlement efforts. It is the latest in a series of breaches involving the private information of Afghan refugees.The breach at Inflite The Jet Centre Ltd, a company that provides ground services for flights linked to the UK’s defence ministry and the Cabinet Office, has exposed the personal data of up to 3,700 people, including Afghans seeking refuge as part of the Afghan Relocations and Assistance Policy. Continue reading...
items.content: Breach at Inflite The Jet Centre is latest in series of leaks involving private information of Afghan refugeesA contractor linked to the UK Ministry of Defence has been hit by a cyber-attack, exposing personal data linked to Afghan resettlement efforts. It is the latest in a series of breaches involving the private information of Afghan refugees.The breach at Inflite The Jet Centre Ltd, a company that provides ground services for flights linked to the UK’s defence ministry and the Cabinet Office, has exposed the personal data of up to 3,700 people, including Afghans seeking refuge as part of the Afghan Relocations and Assistance Policy. Continue reading...

items.title: Afghans resettled in UK hit by new data breach
items.standfirst: Personal data of up to 3,700 Afghans have potentially been exposed after a cyber-attack on a company working with the MoD.
items.content: Personal data of up to 3,700 Afghans have potentially been exposed after a cyber-attack on a company working with the MoD.

clusters.ai_summary:
• A cyberattack targeted a contractor linked to the UK Ministry of Defence.
• The breach exposed personal data of Afghans in a resettlement program.
• Up to 3,700 individuals' data was potentially compromised in the attack.
• The company, Inflite The Jet Centre, provides services for MoD flights.
• This is the latest in a series of data breaches involving Afghan refugees.

items.title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman Expects to Spend ‘Trillions’ on Infrastructure
items.standfirst: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman wants to spend trillions of dollars over time on the infrastructure required to develop and run artificial intelligence services. He just needs to figure out a way to raise that kind of money.
items.content: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman wants to spend trillions of dollars over time on the infrastructure required to develop and run artificial intelligence services. He just needs to figure out a way to raise that kind of money.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Sam Altman expects OpenAI to spend trillions on infrastructure.
• He drew parallels to the late 1990s dot-com bubble.
• The spending is for developing and running AI services.
• Altman wants to raise significant capital for this.
• He believes AI investment is similar to the dot-com era.

clusters.title: US credit spreads hit lowest level this century after sharp rally
clusters.neutral_headline: US Credit Spreads Hit Lowest Level This Century
bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Financial Times

items.title: US credit spreads hit lowest level this century after sharp rally
items.standfirst: Investors warn credit markets are ‘weirdly confident’ despite threats to global economy
items.content: Investors warn credit markets are ‘weirdly confident’ despite threats to global economy

items.title: US credit spreads hit lowest level this century after sharp rally
items.standfirst: Investors warn credit markets are ‘weirdly confident’ despite threats to global economy
items.content: Investors warn credit markets are ‘weirdly confident’ despite threats to global economy

clusters.ai_summary:
• US credit spreads reached their lowest level in this century.
• Investors are warning of "weirdly confident" credit markets.
• This is despite threats to the global economy.
• The sharp rally has led to the low credit spreads.
• The market's confidence is being questioned.

clusters.title: Democrats unveil maps of California's redistricting proposal
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, NPR News

items.title: Democrats unveil maps of California's redistricting proposal
items.standfirst: Democrats unveiled a proposal Friday that could give California's dominant political party an additional five U.S. House seats in a bid to win the fight to control Congress next year.
items.content: Democrats unveiled a proposal Friday that could give California's dominant political party an additional five U.S. House seats in a bid to win the fight to control Congress next year.

items.title: California Democrats unveil their new congressional map to counter Republicans
items.standfirst: As the battle over partisan redistricting mounts, Democrats in California unveil a congressional map that could yield up to five new seats for their party, countering Texas' plan for five GOP seats.
items.content: As the battle over partisan redistricting mounts, Democrats in California unveil a congressional map that could yield up to five new seats for their party, countering Texas' plan for five GOP seats.(Image credit: Rich Pedroncelli)

clusters.ai_summary:
• Democrats unveiled a proposal for California redistricting.
• The proposal could give Democrats five additional House seats.
• The aim is to gain control of Congress.
• The map counters the Republican plan in Texas.
• The battle over redistricting is ongoing.

clusters.title: Liverpool avoid late Bournemouth scare to win Premier League opener
clusters.neutral_headline: Liverpool Defeats Bournemouth in Premier League Opener
bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, BBC Top Stories

items.title: Liverpool avoid late Bournemouth scare to win Premier League opener
items.standfirst: Bournemouth fight back from two down but Liverpool secure late win on emotional Anfield night.
items.content: Bournemouth fight back from two down but Liverpool secure late win on emotional Anfield night.

items.title: Liverpool leave it late to beat Bournemouth in six-goal thriller
items.standfirst: Liverpool begin their Premier League title defence with a win but needed late goals to beat Bournemouth on a night dedicated to former player Diogo Jota.
items.content: Liverpool begin their Premier League title defence with a win but needed late goals to beat Bournemouth on a night dedicated to former player Diogo Jota.

clusters.ai_summary:
• Liverpool won their Premier League opener against Bournemouth with a late victory.
• Bournemouth fought back after being down by two goals early in the match.
• The game was played on an emotional night at Anfield for Liverpool.
• Liverpool secured the win with goals scored late in the match.
• The match was a six-goal thriller between the two teams.

clusters.title: FluMist, a vaccine nasal spray, is now available for use at home
clusters.neutral_headline: FluMist Nasal Spray Vaccine Now Available for Home Use
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, Wired

items.title: FluMist, a vaccine nasal spray, is now available for use at home
items.standfirst: FluMist, the first self-administered flu vaccine spray, is now available for purchase. Here's everything to know, from cost to age requirements and more.
items.content: FluMist, the first self-administered flu vaccine spray, is now available for purchase. Here's everything to know, from cost to age requirements and more.

items.title: Now You Can Get Your Flu Vaccine at Home
items.standfirst: The nasal spray vaccine FluMist can now be ordered online and shipped to your door.
items.content: The nasal spray vaccine FluMist can now be ordered online and shipped to your door.

clusters.ai_summary:
• FluMist, a nasal spray flu vaccine, is now available for self-administration.
• The vaccine can be purchased online and shipped directly to homes.
• Information regarding cost and age requirements is now available.
• This is the first self-administered flu vaccine spray available.
• The vaccine is now available for use at home.
